Modele

Class Conditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • Modele.Conditions

  • public class Conditions
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the condition inscribed at the bottom of each card, for whenever it is a trophy card. The card will be awarded to the player meeting the requirements.
    Author:
    dinh_, tran_

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Conditions(action cond)
      The constructor of conditions that stand on their own.
      Conditions(action cond, int hauteur)
      This is the constructor for conditions that need a face value in order to be met
      Conditions(action cond, suits enseigne)
      This is the constructor for conditions that need a suit in order to be met

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String montrer()
      This method return the nature of the condition.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Conditions

        public Conditions(action cond,
                  suits enseigne)
        This is the constructor for conditions that need a suit in order to be met
        Parameters:
        cond - the action, possible amongst HIGHEST, LOWEST
        enseigne - the suit required, e.g LOWEST CLUB means the jest with the lowest face value club card wins the trophy.

      • Conditions

        public Conditions(action cond,
                  int hauteur)
        This is the constructor for conditions that need a face value in order to be met
        Parameters:
        cond - the only action that requires a face value, MAJORITY
        hauteur - the face value required

      • Conditions

        public Conditions(action cond)
        The constructor of conditions that stand on their own.
        Parameters:
        cond - Possible choices are BEST, BEST_NOJOKER, and JOKER

    • Method Detail

      • montrer

        public java.lang.String montrer()
        This method return the nature of the condition. Will be appended to the description of the card in the console.
        Returns:
        a string describing the condition
